headline: Akamai beats Q4 estimates but stock drops 8% on soft FY2026 outlook
summary: Investing.com -- Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ: AKAM) reported fourth-quarter results that topped Wall Street estimates, but shares fell about 8% in after-hours trading Thursday as investors focused on weaker-than-expected full-year guidance. The cybersecurity and cloud computing company posted Q4 non-GAAP earnings of $1.84 per share, beating the $1.75 consensus estimate. Revenue rose 7% year over year to $1.095 billion, slightly ahead of expectations for $1.08 billion. Growth was driven by streng

headline: Akamai Technologies: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of nine analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.75 per share. The cloud services provider posted revenue of $1.09 billion in the period, also surpassing Street forecasts. Seven analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $1.08 billion.

headline: Akamai Technologies’s (NASDAQ:AKAM) Q4 CY2025 Sales Beat Estimates But Stock Drops
summary: Cloud technology company Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ:AKAM) reported Q4 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 7.4% year on year to $1.09 billion. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $1.07 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.84 per share was 5.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Akamai forecasts downbeat quarterly profit, shares fall
summary: Akamai Technologies forecast first-quarter adjusted profit below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, signaling that the ongoing ‌memory supply squeeze will increase costs, sending its shares ‌down nearly 9% after the bell.  CEO Tom Leighton told Reuters in an interview that Akamai ‌is also experiencing higher ⁠memory costs and might have to pass some of that on to customers.  The company expects adjusted profit per share between $1.50 and $1.67 in the first quarter, below analysts' average estimate of $1.75, according to data compiled by LSEG.

headline: What Catalysts Are Reframing The Story For Akamai Technologies (AKAM)?
summary: The latest update to the Akamai Technologies narrative centers on a slightly higher fair value estimate, now at $102.72 versus $101.16, supported by an adjusted discount rate of 9.72% versus 10.21% and a long term revenue growth assumption of 7.58% versus 6.99%. These tweaks mirror a recent run of more optimistic Street commentary that highlights steadier core trends and fresh interest in areas such as compute and AI infrastructure. Stay tuned to see how you can keep on top of future shifts...

headline: Traders Left With ‘Unscratchable Itch’ for Anthropic Exposure
summary: For nearly a month investors have raced to dump shares of companies that could be disrupted by AI tools like Anthropic’s Claude Cowork.  Sharp selling has been seen by a wide variety of sectors including software, legal services, wealth management and transportation logistics on worries that the tools could erode growth, demand and pricing power at traditional companies.  This absence of a publicly traded companies that offer some kind of exposure or correlation to Anthropic is becoming a frustration for traders, who are instead stuck trying to side-step the growing a list of stocks that have plunged because of its tools.
